p: The palisade parenchyma cells were located immediately below the epidermis and were ellipsoidal in shape; the spongy mesophyll cells appeared globular in shape and were mostly distributed at the transitional region with the palisade parenchyma or adjacent to the abaxial epidermis ( Figure 1b). In the young stems, these cells displayed a smaller diameter and a globular shape and occurred in the bark, in the cortical parenchyma, or were associated to the xylem medullary rays ( Figure 1c).
